reviews.review: I could say about how the movie lacks originality or about the annoying product placement or perhaps even the fact that this truly shows the face of hollywood greed. But this is a movie about emojis. Those little things in your phone that only teenage girls use unless of course you are middle aged and trying to be 'hip and cool'. I don't think I need to waste my time typing to show you how bad it is. Could you stoop any lower as a human being by seeing this movie? Not really. Not unless you were one of the monsters involved with making it.

I decided to watch this movie because I had heard it was arguably one of the worst movies ever made, and I was not disappointed.  I cannot comprehend how movies like this get made and we still haven't gotten a sequel to the 5th Element.  The entire premise is just bafflingly bad and literally makes no sense.  I really hope all of the big names who participated in this are forever reminded of their part in making a movie that should literally get the title of worst movie ever made.  This is worse than Jared Leto's Joker in Suicide Squad, and that is saying something
My bro... this movie was a BOMB. Horrible
The kids enjoyed it. Didn't want to make me claw my eyes out   Cute premise.

This movie was horrible in every way possible. Crappy jokes, speaking of crap there are so many stupid jokes when the poop emoji was around, and there where lots of other things i would talk about but i don't feel like it because i want to tell you the worst part. The end is literally just an ad for the new animoji, at the end (Spoiler Warning) the meh emoji use its abilities as a "malfunction" and look like other emojis and changes during a scan to look animated, and eventually animated emojis were put on the IPhone X. Stupid.

My kids warned me this was a dumb movie.  Even their friends warned me.  Wow, this was dumb.  Really hit stupid when they stuck a couple feminist hints of oppression to female emojis (apparently it's a thing).  One of the worst kids' movies we've ever seen.  DELETE!

With surface level humor and flat, one-dimensional characters, The Emoji Movie is a stale, incohesive marketing ploy that lacks the wit, originality, and heart of the films it's clearly trying to replicate.
Absolutely the greatest movie no question it was perfectly filmed created and perfectly drawn out you have to watch it I mean it's about emojis!!! Great for dank members or millenialls
Had some good, hard laughs at times and was enjoyable overall.
